article.paragraph: DISPLAYTITLE:List of games based on ''Dune''A number of games have been published which are based on theDune (franchise)''Dune'' universecreated byFrank Herbert.
article.heading: Card games

article.heading: Video games
article.paragraph: To date, there have been five licensedDune-related video games released. There have also been manyDune-basedMUDs(Multi-User Dimension) andWeb browserbrowser-based online games, all created and run by fans.cite webhttp://dune.servint.com/general/about_dunemud.phpDuneMUDDune.servint.comMarch 17, 2010
article.heading: Dune(1992)
article.paragraph: MainDune (video game)1992'sDunefromCryo Interactive/Virgin Interactiveblends adventure with strategy.cite webhttp://www.mobygames.com/game/duneGame Overview: ''Dune'' (1992)Mobygames.comMarch 17, 2010cite webhttp://www.abandonia.com/games/46/download/Dune.htmReview: ''Dune'' (1992) - Game download availableAbandonia.comMarch 17, 2010Loosely following the story of the 1965 novelDune (novel)Duneand using many visual elements from the 1984Dune (film)film of the same namebyDavid Lynch, the game casts the player asPaul Atreides, with the ultimate goal of driving theHouse HarkonnenHarkonnensfrom the planetArrakisDuneand taking control of its valuable export, themelange (fictional drug)spice.Key to success is the management of spice mining, military forces, and ecology as the player amasses allies and skills.
article.heading: Dune II(1992)
article.paragraph: MainDune IIDune II: The Building of a Dynasty, later retitledDune II: Battle for Arrakisfor theSega GenesisMega Drive/Genesisport, was released in December 1992 fromWestwood Studios/Virgin Interactive.cite webhttp://www.mobygames.com/game/dune-ii-the-building-of-a-dynastyGame Overview: ''Dune II: The Building of a Dynasty'' (1992)Mobygames.comMarch 17, 2010cite webhttp://www.abandonia.com/games/36/download/Dune2.htmReview: ''Dune II - The Building of a Dynasty'' (1992) - Game download availableAbandonia.comMarch 17, 2010Often considered to be the first "mainstream modernreal-time strategygame",Dune IIestablished many conventions of the genre.Only loosely connected to the plot of the novels or films, the game pits three interplanetary houses — theHouse AtreidesAtreides, theHouse HarkonnenHarkonnens, and theHouse OrdosOrdos— against each other for control of the planetArrakisand its valuable spice, all while fending off the destructive natural forces of the harshdesert planetitself.
article.heading: Dune 2000(1998)
article.paragraph: MainDune 2000Dune 2000, a 1998Video game remakeremakeofDune IIfromIntelligent Games/Westwood Studios/Virgin Interactive, added improved graphics andlive-actioncutscenes.cite webhttp://www.mobygames.com/game/dune-2000Game Overview: ''Dune 2000'' (1998)Mobygames.comMarch 17, 2010Though gameplay is similar to its predecessor,Dune 2000features an enhanced storyline and functionality.
article.heading: Emperor: Battle for Dune(2001)
article.paragraph: MainEmperor: Battle for DuneEmperor: Battle for Dune(Intelligent Games/Westwood Studios/Electronic Arts) was released on June 12, 2001.cite webhttp://www.mobygames.com/game/emperor-battle-for-duneGame Overview: ''Emperor: Battle for Dune'' (2001)Mobygames.comMarch 17, 2010A sequel toDune 2000, the real-time strategy game features 3D graphics and live-action cutscenes and casts players as Atreides, Harkonnens, or Ordos.cite webhttp://www.guru3d.com/gamereviews/dune/Review: ''Emperor: Battle for Dune'' (2001)Guru3D.comMarch 17, 2010
article.heading: Frank Herbert's Dune(2001)
article.paragraph: MainFrank Herbert's Dune (video game)Released in 2001 byCryo Interactive/DreamCatcher Interactive,Frank Herbert's Duneis a3D computer graphics3Dvideo game based on the 2000SyfySci Fi ChannelFrank Herbert's Duneminiseries of the same name.cite webhttp://www.mobygames.com/game/frank-herberts-duneGame Overview: ''Frank Herbert's Dune'' (2001)Mobygames.comMarch 17, 2010As Paul Muad'Dib Atreides, the player must become leader of theFremen, seize control of Dune, and defeat the evilVladimir HarkonnenBaron Harkonnen.The game was not a commercial or critical success, and Cryo subsequently filed for bankruptcy in July 2002.cite webhttp://www.mobygames.com/company/cryo-interactive-entertainmentOverview: Cryo Interactive EntertainmentMobyGames.comMarch 17, 2010anchorDUNE Generations
article.heading: DUNE Generations(2001, cancelled)
article.paragraph: Image:Dune generations logo.pngright175px''DUNE Generations'' logoIn 2001,Cryonetworksdisclosed information aboutDune Generations, an online, 3D real-time strategy game set in theDuneuniverse.cite webhttp://www.dunegenerations.com/''DUNE Generations'': Main PageDuneGenerations.com (Internet Archive)November 27, 2001http://web.archive.org/web/20011127215041/http://www.dunegenerations.com/November 27, 2001cite webhttp://www.gamespot.com/pc/strategy/dunegenerations/news.html?sid''DUNE Generations'' Q&AMay 30, 2001Gamespot.comMarch 17, 2010An official website for the upcoming game featured concept images, a brief background story and description of the persistent gameworld, and a list of frequently asked questions.cite webhttp://www.dunegenerations.com/uk/html/faq.htm''DUNE Generations'':FAQDuneGenerations.comOctober 21, 2001http://web.archive.org/web/20011021081521/http://www.dunegenerations.com/uk/html/faq.htmOctober 21, 2001The game would be constructed using Cryo's own online multimedia development frameworkSCOL.cite webhttp://www.dunegenerations.com/uk/html/develop01.htm#''DUNE Generations'': DevelopmentDuneGenerations.com (Internet Archive)January 5, 2002http://web.archive.org/web/20020105205044/http://www.dunegenerations.com/uk/html/develop01.htm#January 5, 2002

Within "the infrastructure of a permanent and massive multiplayer world that exists online,"DUNE Generationswould let players assume control of a dynasty in theDuneuniverse, with the goal of first mastering the natural resources of their own homeworlds and ultimately rising in power and influence through conflicts and alliances with other player dynasties.cite webhttp://www.dunegenerations.com/uk/html/lejeu.htm''DUNE Generations'': ConceptDuneGenerations.com (Internet Archive)October 19, 2001http://web.archive.org/web/20011019220154/http://www.dunegenerations.com/uk/html/lejeu.htmOctober 19, 2001Each of the three available dynasty types — traders, soldiers, or mercenaries — would provide a different playing experience, all with the long-term goal of gaining control of Arrakis and its valuable spice.

A preview videotrailer (film)trailerwas released in November 2001.cite webhttp://www.thedune.ru/cgi-bin/ccc/counter.pl?dunegen/video/dunegenerations.aviPreview Video Trailer: ''DUNE Generations'' (6 MB)Thedune.ruMarch 17, 2010The game was still in thealpha testingstage in February 2002,cite webhttp://www.dune-generations.com/index_uk.htm''DUNE Generations'': Information PreviewingDune-Generations.comFebruary 25, 2002http://web.archive.org/web/20021211010037/http://www.dune-generations.com/index_uk.htmDecember 11, 2002and the project was ultimately halted after Cryo filed for bankruptcy in July 2002.
